result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lavance Darell Conley

records.addlTxt: Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Of Commitment for Treatment ( Incompetency), signed and filed.
Copy forwarded to DHS-admission.

Defendant Lavance Darell Conley in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Lavance Darell Conley in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for return on doctors report.   Court reviews doctor's report with the parties.  State, defense counsel and defendant are not challenging the findings of the doctor's report. 
Court finds the defendant lacks substantial capacity to understand court proceedings or to assist in his own defense.  Court orders proceedings suspended.   
Court ordered defendant committed to the Department of Health and Family Services for Institutional Care in order to restore competency within the statutory time frame.  
Defendant is REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department for transportation to the designated facility FORTHWITH.  
Proposed Order of Commitment forward to the Judge.     Court ordered matter adjourned back to  Branch 19.  Review hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Lavance Darell Conley not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a return on Dr's Report.  Case heard in Branch 40 for Branch 45.  No report filed.  Court adjourned matter to Branch 45.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Forensic evaluation ordered.  INITIAL APPEARANCE NOT HELD.  Trial court to address INITIAL APPEARANCE.

Defendant Lavance Darell Conley in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Lavance Darell Conley in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lavance Darell Conley appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge *, Branch *.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Commissioner tolls the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
